<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 275, 324, 292]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 291]]<|/det|>
9231/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 270, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 213, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 730, 714]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 72, 589, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(k\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 97, 576, 115]]<|/det|>
\[x + 5y + 6z = 1,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 118, 574, 136]]<|/det|>
\[kx + 2y + 2z = 2,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[423, 139, 574, 157]]<|/det|>
\[-3x + 4y + 8z = 3,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 163, 609, 181]]<|/det|>
has a unique solution and interpret this situation geometrically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 920, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 71, 235, 88]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 96, 692, 123]]<|/det|>
\[x = 1 + \frac{1}{t}\qquad \mathrm{and}\qquad y = \cos^{-1}t\qquad \mathrm{for} 0< t< 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 146, 146, 165]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 140, 304, 170]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{t^2}{\sqrt{1 - t^2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 148, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 808, 114]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2} = -\mathrm{r}^a\big(1 - \mathrm{r}^2\big)^b\big(2 - \mathrm{r}^2\big)\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 537, 92]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to find \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 544, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 109, 609, 144]]<|/det|>
\[6\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} -5\frac{\mathrm{dx}}{\mathrm{d}t} +x = t^{2} + t + 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 160, 484, 185]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t = 0\), \(x = 12\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dx}}{\mathrm{d}t} = -6\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 92, 870, 279]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 297, 920, 349]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \left(\frac{1}{2}\right)^{x}\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(N\) rectangles each of width \(\frac{1}{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 352, 144, 373]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 349, 856, 384]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that \(\int_{0}^{1}\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)^{x}\mathrm{d}x > L_{N}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 395, 574, 435]]<|/det|>
\[L_{N} = \frac{1}{2N\left(2^{\frac{1}{N}} - 1\right)}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 401, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 77, 767, 103]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(N\), an upper bound \(U_{N}\) for \(\int_{0}^{1}\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)^{x} \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 625, 181, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 616, 562, 641]]<|/det|>
Find the least value of \(N\) such that \(U_N - L_N \leqslant 10^{-3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 623, 920, 642]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 78, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\int_{0}^{1}\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)^{x} \mathrm{d}x = \frac{1}{2 \ln 2}\), use the value of \(N\) found in part **(c)** to find upper and lower bounds for \(\ln 2\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 915, 140]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 915, 201]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 240, 915, 260]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 300, 915, 320]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 369, 915, 389]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 421, 96, 441]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 421, 143, 441]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 421, 520, 441]]<|/det|>
Show that an appropriate integrating factor for

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 445, 616, 476]]<|/det|>
\[\sqrt{x^{2} + 16}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y = x\sqrt{x^{2} + 16}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 496, 306, 520]]<|/det|>
is \(\frac{1}{4} x + \frac{1}{4} \sqrt{x^2 + 16}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 500, 917, 519]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 71, 554, 89]]<|/det|>
Hence find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 94, 616, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\sqrt{x^{2} + 16}\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y = x\sqrt{x^{2} + 16}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[141, 133, 386, 152]]<|/det|>
for which \(y = 6\) when \(x = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 96, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 146, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 78, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
By considering the binomial expansion of \(\left(z + \frac{1}{z}\right)^7\), where \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\), use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 127, 683, 147]]<|/det|>
\[\cos^{7}\theta = a\cos 7\theta +b\cos 5\theta +c\cos 3\theta +d\cos \theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[143, 159, 551, 179]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b, c\) and \(d\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 160, 920, 179]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 698, 91]]<|/det|>
Using the results given in parts (a) and (b), find the exact value of \(I_9\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 89]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
